intro: Erigeron berteroanus, commonly known as the desert blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky slopes, and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient soils. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant has hairy stems and leaves that help reduce water loss. Erigeron berteroanus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with minimal water availability.
